intro: Banisteriopsis martiniana var. laevis, commonly known as the smooth banisteriopsis, is a climbing plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are berries that turn red when mature, containing several seeds. This species is often used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
